What is the purpose of the `z_listaddresses` command in Verus?
The `z_listaddresses` command returns a list of Sprout and Sapling shielded addresses belonging to the wallet.

z_listaddresses ( includeWatchonly ) Returns the list of Sprout and Sapling shielded addresses belonging to the wallet. Arguments: 1. includeWatchonly (bool, optional, default=false) Also include watchonly addresses (see 'z_importviewingkey') Result: [           (json array of string)  "zaddr"      (string) a zaddr belonging to the wallet  ,... ] Examples: > verus z_listaddresses > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_listaddresses", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What is the optional argument `includeWatchonly` in the `z_listaddresses` command, and what does it do?

The `includeWatchonly` argument is a boolean optional parameter that defaults to `false`. If set to `true`, it will also include watch-only addresses in the list of shielded addresses returned by the command.

z_listaddresses ( includeWatchonly ) Returns the list of Sprout and Sapling shielded addresses belonging to the wallet. Arguments: 1. includeWatchonly (bool, optional, default=false) Also include watchonly addresses (see 'z_importviewingkey') Result: [           (json array of string)  "zaddr"      (string) a zaddr belonging to the wallet  ,... ] Examples: > verus z_listaddresses > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_listaddresses", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
How can I use the `z_listaddresses` command to get a list of shielded addresses in my wallet?

You can use the `z_listaddresses` command in the following way to get a list of shielded addresses in your wallet:

```
verus z_listaddresses
```

Alternatively, you can use the `curl` command to send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus node:

```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_listaddresses", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

This will return a JSON array of strings, where each string is a shielded address belonging to the wallet.

z_listaddresses ( includeWatchonly ) Returns the list of Sprout and Sapling shielded addresses belonging to the wallet. Arguments: 1. includeWatchonly (bool, optional, default=false) Also include watchonly addresses (see 'z_importviewingkey') Result: [           (json array of string)  "zaddr"      (string) a zaddr belonging to the wallet  ,... ] Examples: > verus z_listaddresses > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_listaddresses", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
